images.copyright: Northern lights near Whitehorse in Yukon, Canada (© Design Pics/Danita Delimont)
images.title: A 'horse' of many colors
images.caption: A 'horse' of many colors
images.desc: Whitehorse, Yukon's only city and the largest in northern Canada, will have just seven hours of daylight today, but nature has a way of compensating for this injustice. The area enjoys frequent and spectacular light shows, thanks to the aurora borealis. The mechanics of northern lights are still not fully understood, but scientists agree that solar winds—big pulses of energy from our sun—pass through the Earth's magnetic fields, especially at the polar regions, resulting in shimmering colors.
